data.title: John W. Knott Bookseller LLC
data.meta_description: Browse all featured items John W. Knott Bookseller LLC
data.text:
A. MERRITT'S FANTASY MAGAZINE. April 1950. (Volume 1, No. 3).

A. MERRITT'S FANTASY MAGAZINE.

Kokomo, IN: Recreational Reading, Inc., an affiliate of Popular Publications, Inc., 1950. Octavo, single issue, cover by Norman Saunders, pictorial wrappers. Pulp magazine. Includes "The Ninth Life" by Jack Mann. [Reference: Tymm and Ashley, Science Fiction, Fantasy, and Weird Fiction Magazines, pp. 3-6].

Aldiss, Brian W[ilson].

FRANKENSTEIN UNBOUND.

New York: Random House, [1974]. Octavo, cloth. First U.S. edition. A 1990 film directed by Roger Corman was based on this novel. [Reference: Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-9. Barron (ed), Horror Literature 4-10. Survey of Science Fiction Literature II, pp. 840-4].

Anonymously Edited Anthology.

THE BOOK OF A THOUSAND THRILLS: ALL-STAR STORIES OF MYSTERY, CRIME AND ROMANCE.

London: Allied Newspapers Ltd., n.d., [193-]. Octavo, original pictorial blue cloth, front and spine panels stamped in black. First edition. 1023-page anthology with fifty stories by Ruby M. Ayres, Cameron Blake, Victor Bridges. John Buchan, Reginald Campbell, Leslie Charteris, J. S. Fletcher, R. Austin Freeman, and others. [Reference: Contento and Greenberg, Index to Crime and Mystery Anthologies, pp. 547-48].

Asimov, Isaac.

FOUNDATION.

New York: Gnome Press, Publishers, [1951]. Octavo, jacket painting by David Kyle, cloth. First edition, first binding. The first volume in the Foundation series, awarded a special Hugo award in 1966 for best all-time series. [Reference: Anatomy of Wonder (1995) 3-12. Survey of Science Fiction Literature II, pp. 819-31].

ASTOUNDING SCIENCE FICTION. April, 1939. (Volume 23, No. 2). John W. Campbell, Jr., editor.

ASTOUNDING SCIENCE FICTION.

New York: Street & Smith Publications, Inc., 1939. Octavo, single issue, cover painting by Charles Schneeman, pictorial wrappers. Pulp magazine. Includes Part 3 of "The Cosmic Engineers" by Clifford Simak, part 1 of "One Against the Legion" by Jack Williamson. [Reference: Tymm and Ashley, Science Fiction, Fantasy, and Weird Fiction Magazines, pp. 60-103].

ASTOUNDING SCIENCE FICTION. August, 1940. (Volume 25, No. 6). John W. Campbell, Jr., editor.

ASTOUNDING SCIENCE FICTION.

New York: Street & Smith Publications, Inc., 1940. Octavo, single issue cover painting by Hubert Rogers, pictorial wrappers. Pulp magazine. Fiction by Lester Del Rey, A.E. van Vogt, Clifford Simak and others. [Reference: Tymm and Ashley, Science Fiction, Fantasy, and Weird Fiction Magazines, pp. 60-103].

ASTOUNDING STORIES OF SUPER SCIENCE. January, 1933. (Volume 11, Number 3). Harry Bates, editor.

ASTOUNDING STORIES OF SUPER SCIENCE.

New York: The Clayton Magazines, Inc., 1933. Octavo, single issue, cover painting by Wesso[lowski], pictorial wrappers. Pulp magazine. Murray Leinster cover story. The penultimate Clayton issue. Tymm and Ashley, Science Fiction, Fantasy, and Weird Fiction Magazines, pp. 60-103.

Avallone, Michael.

THE CASE OF THE BOUNCING BETTY bound with THE CASE OF THE VIOLENT VIRGIN.

New York: Ace Books, [1957]. Small octavo, pictorial wrappers. First edition. Ace double D-259. Paperback original. Two Ed Noon novels, first book publication for both. [Reference: Jaffery, S., Double Trouble: A Bibliographic Chronicle of Ace Mystery Doubles, pp. 55-57. Pronzini and Muller, 1001 Midnights, The Aficionado's Guide to Mystery and Detective Fiction, pp. 31-32].

Ballard, J[ames] G[raham].

THE DAY OF FOREVER.

London: Victor Gollancz Ltd, 1986. Octavo, boards. First hardcover edition. Collects ten stories, contents as per 1967 Panther Books edition. [Reference: Anatomy of Wonder (1981) 3-54].

Baxter, Stephen.

THE WEB: GULLIVERZONE.

[London]. Orion Children's Books and Dolphin Paperbacks, [1997]. Small octavo, pictorial boards. First edition. Signed by Baxter on the title page. Young adult SF, part of a series written by multiple authors.

Berkeley, Anthony (pseudonym for Anthony Berkeley Cox).

THE WYCHFORD POISONING CASE.

Garden City, NY: Published for the Crime Club, Inc. by Doubleday, Doran & Company, Inc., 1930. Octavo, pp. [i-vi] vii-viii [ix-x] 1- 308 [309: Crime Club statement] [310: blank], cloth. First U.S. edition. Mystery novel featuring sleuth Roger Sheringham, the second published (in England in 1926).

[Birkin, Charles Lloyd (editor).]

QUAKES: A COLLECTION OF UNEASY TALES.

London: Philip Allan, [1933]. Octavo, pp. [1-4] 5 [6-8] 9-252 [253-256: ads], original yellow cloth, spine panel stamped in black. First edition. Original anthology collecting thirteen stories by Birkin (as "Charles Lloyd"), Douglas Newton, Elliott Oâ€™Donnell and others. Part of the classic fourteen volume "Creeps" series. [Reference: Barron (ed), Horror Literature 3-23. Bleiler, The Guide to Supernatural Fiction 1351. Bleiler (1978), p. 8. Reginald 11946].

Bischoff, David F. and Dennis R. Bailey.

TIN WOODMAN.

Garden City: Doubleday & Company, Inc., 1979. Octavo, boards. First edition. Novel based on short story of the same title nominated for the 1977 Nebula award.

Bloch, Robert.

BLOOD RUNS COLD.

London: Robert Hale Limited, [1963]. Octavo, boards. First British edition. Collects thirteen stories (omitting four from the U.S. edition), mixture of crime and horror stories.

Bradbury, Ray.

FEVER DREAM.

New York: St. Martin's Press, [1987]. Octavo, boards. First separate edition. Inscribed and signed by Bradbury with a drawing on the front free end paper to a well known fan. A short story by Bradbury first published in Weird Tales in 1948, this version illustrated by Darrel Anderson. A "Night Lights Glow in the Dark Books" series for young readers (ages 8-12).

Bradbury, Ray.

THE MARTIAN CHRONICLES.

Garden City: Doubleday & Company, Inc., 1950. Octavo, cloth. First edition. Brief signed inscription by Bradbury on the title page. Bradbury's second and most famous book, a collection of closely linked stories about the exploration and colonization of Mars. [Reference: Anatomy of Wonder (2004) II-154. Bleiler, The Guide to Supernatural Fiction 255. Pringle, Science Fiction: The 100 Best Novels 3. Survey of Science Fiction Literature III, pp. 1348-52].
